channel.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
channel.description: for some reason i shut my computer down and when i turned it back on no one could connect. ive shut it down before and it worked still and also the server works because im able tog et on so i think it has something to do with the portforwarding. ive gone through and double checked the no ip and the router stuff and i cant figure it out. does anyone know why it would be working one moment then not after a restart?

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @ryan_justin ryan justin
item.description:
@ryan_justin wrote:

ok i found router startus and theres an ip for internet port and LAN port. im assuming internet port it looks like its the same ip as its always been but if i go to one of those sites that tells my ip sohuld it look the same?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 22, 2009, 02:37:39 am[/size][hr]whats the difference between my server ip and my router ip and my computers ip?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 22, 2009, 02:38:34 am[/size][hr]whats the difference between the server ip the router ip and my computers ip?

Read full topic
item.source: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Your router IP stays the same your computers IP could change due to the router. go to your network connection, right click your internet connection your using, hit status, then click support, and look for your ip address it will be something like 128.165.3.1 something like that don’t use the default gateway because that is the routers ip.

Read full topic
item.source: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @ryan_justin ryan justin
item.description:
@ryan_justin wrote:

i tried adding the exception and it was already in there and checked but thanks though.

if my local ip changed how would i know what my router ip is? im able to get on the router info page but from there where?

Read full topic
item.source: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

runefreak10:

You local IP probably changed.

If your ip changes when you shut your computer off, you will need to change the ip in your router so they match or else the router denies access to your computer.

Read full topic
item.source: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

You local IP probably changed.

Read full topic
item.source: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect

item.title: Shut down computer and now nobody can connect
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Or go to your router.

Ive shut my computer off and had to change stuff in my router before, so just to be on the safe side make sure your computers ip and the one in the router are matching.

If you don’t use a router, I am not sure what else to say.

Good luck with fixing your problem.

Read full topic

well if you did i coude do it for you but go into control panel > windows firewall > exceptions press add port and add 43594
